page.title: 12DERWENT VALLEY - WILD LIFE
page.content: Many members of the tit family are well represented; common blue, great and long-tailed tits, also the rarer coal, marsh and willow tits and the nuthatch. Summer visitors include redstart, chiffchaff, willow and garden warbler, blackcap and, occasionally, the grasshopper warbler. Hawfinch and goldfinch are increasing in numbers. Goldcrest, crossbill, woodcock, green and great spotted woodpeckers have Chopwell Woodlands as their favourite locality. In the Hamsterley Mill area, the much rarer lesser spotted woodpecker is found. One noticeable newcomer, the collared dove, is now common here. Chopwell Woodlands' ponds, formed by German bombing in the 2nd World War,contain all 3 species of British newts. Pond drainage means toads and frogs are less common.
